data.name: ApplicationDescription
data.value: Generates answer files (unattend.xml and autounattend.xml) for unattended Windows installation.

data.name: AutoLogonCountDescription
data.value: The number of times the user specified by -AutoLogonUser will be automatically logged on.

data.name: AutoLogonPasswordDescription
data.value: The password of the user specified by -AutoLogonUser.

data.name: AutoLogonUserDescription
data.value: The name of a user to automatically log on, in the format 'domain\user', or just 'user' for local users. If not specified, automatic logon will not be used.

data.name: CategoryAutoLogon
data.value: Automatic logon options:

data.name: CategoryDomain
data.value: Domain options:

data.name: CategoryInstall
data.value: Installation options:

data.name: CategoryOther
data.value: Other setup options:

data.name: CategoryUserAccounts
data.value: User account options:

data.name: CmdKeyPasswordDescription
data.value: The password of the user specified by -CmdKeyUser.

data.name: CmdKeyUserDescription
data.value: The name of a user used to access all network resources, in 'domain\user' format. If present, the cmdkey.exe application will be used at first logon to save this user's credentials for all network paths.

data.name: ComputerNameDescription
data.value: The network name for the computer.

data.name: DisableCloudDescription
data.value: Disable Windows cloud consumer features. This prevents auto-installation of recommended store apps.

data.name: DisableDefenderDesciption
data.value: Disable Windows Defender virus and threat protection.

data.name: DisableServerManagerDescription
data.value: Do not automatically start Server Manager when logging on (Windows Server only).

data.name: DisplayResolutionDescription
data.value: The display resolution, in the format 'width,height'. For example, '1920,1080'. If not specified, the default resolution is determined by Windows.

data.name: DomainAccountsDescription
data.value: The name of a domain account to add to a local group, using the format 'group:domain\user', 'domain\user', 'group:user' or 'user'. If no group is specified, the user is added to the local Administrators group. You can specify multiple groups by separating them with semicolons. If no domain is specified, the user must be in the domain you're joining. Can have multiple values.

data.name: DomainUserGroupValueDescription
data.value: [Group:][Domain\]User

data.name: DomainUserValueDescription
data.value: Domain\User

data.name: EnableRemoteDesktopDescriptoin
data.value: Turn on remote desktop, and create a Windows Defender Firewall rule to allow incoming connections.

data.name: FeaturesDescription
data.value: The name of an optional feature to install. Use the PowerShell 'Get-WindowsOptionalFeature' command to get a list of valid feature names. Can have multiple values.

data.name: FirstLogonCommandsDescription
data.value: A command to run during first logon. Can have multiple values. Commands are executed before the scripts specified by -SetupScript.

data.name: ImageIndexDescription
data.value: The index of the image in the WIM file to install. Use this for Windows editions not installed using a product key, such as those that use volume licensing. Use the PowerShell 'Get-WindowsImage' command to list all images in a .wim or .esd file.

data.name: InstallDescription
data.value: The installation method to use.

data.name: InstallToDiskDescription
data.value: The zero-based ID of the disk to install to. This disk will be wiped and repartitioned according to -Partition, or using the default layout if -Partition is not specified.

data.name: InstallToPartitionDescription
data.value: The one-based ID of the partition to install to, on the disk specified by -InstallToDisk. If not specified and -Install is CleanEfi or CleanBios, Windows will be installed on the first regular data partition. If -Install is ExistingPartition, the default value is 3, which is appropriate for UEFI systems with the default partition layout.

data.name: InvalidMethodCount
data.value: Need at least one method.

data.name: JoinDomainDescription
data.value: The name of a domain to join. If not specified, the system will not be joined to a domain.

data.name: JoinDomainPasswordDescription
data.value: The password of the user specified by -JoinDomainUser. Will be stored in plain text.

data.name: JoinDomainUserDescription
data.value: The name of a user with permission to join the domain specified by -JoinDomain. Use the format 'domain\user', or just 'user' if the user is a member of the domain you are joining.

data.name: LanguageDescription
data.value: The language used for the UI language, and the input, system and user locales.

data.name: LocalAccountsDescription
data.value:
A local account to create, using the format 'group:name,password' or 'name,password'. Can have multiple values. If no group is specified, the user will be added to the Administrators group. You can specify multiple groups by separating them with semicolons.
If no local accounts are created, the user will be asked to create one during OOBE, making setup not fully unattended.

data.name: LocalCredentialValueDescription
data.value: [Group:]Name,Password

data.name: NumberValueDescription
data.value: Number

data.name: OnlineHelpDescription
data.value: Shows additional help in your web browser, including example usage.

data.name: OnlineHelpUrl
data.value: https://github.com/SvenGroot/GenerateAnswerFile

data.name: OptionalDomainUserValueDescription
data.value: [Domain\]User

data.name: OUPathDescription
data.value: The organizational unit to use when joining the domain specified by -JoinDomain.

data.name: OutputFileDescription
data.value: The path and file name to write the answer file to. If not specified, the generated answer file is written to the console.

data.name: PartitionsDescription
data.value:
A partition to create on the disk specified by -InstallToDisk. Can have multiple values.
Use the format 'label:size' or 'label:size[fs]', where label is the volume label, size is the size of the partition, and fs is an optional file system like FAT32 or NTFS. Sizes can use multiple-byte units such as GB, and will be truncated to whole megabytes. For example 'System:100MB', 'Windows:128GB', or 'Data:16GB[FAT32]'.
Use '*' as the size to extend the partition to fill the remainder of the disk (e.g. 'Windows:*').
Use the following labels to create special partitions: 'System', 'MSR', 'WinRE', and 'Recovery'.
If not specified, the default partition layout for the method specified by -Install is used.

data.name: PartitionsValueDescription
data.value: Label:Size

data.name: PathValueDescription
data.value: Path

data.name: ProcessorArchitectureDescription
data.value: The processor architecture of the Windows edition you're installing. Use 'amd64' for 64 bit Intel and AMD processors, 'x86' for 32 bit, and 'arm64' for ARM-based devices.

data.name: ProductKeyDescription
data.value: The product key used to select what edition to install, and to activate Windows.

data.name: SetupScriptsDescription
data.value: The full path of a Windows PowerShell script to run during first logon. Can have multiple values. Scripts are executed after the commands specified by -FirstLogonCommand.

data.name: TimeZoneDescription
data.value: The time zone that Windows will use. Run 'tzutil /l' for a list of valid values.

data.name: UsageHelpFooterFormat
data.value:
Options can also be specified by piping a JSON file to the standard input. In this case, only the -OutputFile argument can be used.
For more information, as well as usage examples, run '{0} -OnlineHelp', or see: https://github.com/SvenGroot/GenerateAnswerFile

data.name: UsageHelpMoreInfoFormat
data.value: Run '{0} -Help' or '{0} -OnlineHelp' for more information, or see: https://github.com/SvenGroot/GenerateAnswerFile

data.name: ValidateInstallMethodErrorFormat
data.value: The '{0}' argument may only be used if -Install is set to {1}.

data.name: ValidateInstallMethodUsageFormat
data.value: May only be used if -Install is set to {0}.

data.name: WindowsVersionDescription
data.value: The exact version and build number (e.g. '10.0.22621.1') of the OS being installed. This argument is only used when -Feature is specified.

data.name: JsonUsageFooter
data.value: JSON input was found; additional arguments are available if JSON input is not provided. For more information, see: https://github.com/SvenGroot/GenerateAnswerFile
